dialogues.text: (gloomy & fatalistic) Soon as they peel Chrissy outta under that bus there’s gonna be people coming over anyway...what a buncha bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: DEZ
dialogues.text: Better hustle then. CLOSE ON RUTH AGAIN, drooping back down, eyes clamping sh

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: (barely audible) ...-please... INT. FRONT ROOM - TONY’S HOUSE - DAY SLOWLY PUSHING IN ON TONY, slumped there on the couch. Hi eyes land sadly on something 0.S. and he reaches for it. Crinkle, crinkle. He lifts the now-unwrapped slice of American cheese to his mouth for a sad nibble. Chew, chew chew. Washes it down with some soda. Abh. There. He feels a little better now. Looks over at.. Brian, curled in the corner, staring back as if in anticipation. Tony’s expression becomes serious again.  78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BUS AND VARIOUS COP CARS as out-of-focus foreground elements. LIGHTS FLASHING and BLURRY OFFICIAL HUBBUB. IN THE BACKGROUND, at the rear of the small CROWD at the yellow tape, TONY'S HEAD pops up above them, scanning as- IN THE FOREGROUND, a STRETCHER goes by, a BODY under a sh Tony questions an ONLOOKER, who gestures at the cops and EXT. RUTH’S HOUSE - DAY Tony approaches and gives a light knock-knock but...THE D was a little bit opened already. INT. FRONT ROOM - RUTH’S HOUSE - SAME He steps inside, hesitantly.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Ruth? No answer. He looks over at... THE TIGER, sideways on the floor, silently snarling at hi DOOMY SCORE kicks in and carries us over to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE VAN pushing ominously through the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruth rocks forward as the van comes to a halt. Marshall looks back at her, the .45 loose in his hand. Dez loads the RUSTY SHOTGUN. She has to force the shell i Ruth shivers, waiting for whatever’s next. She watches as Marshall WHISPERS something in Dez’s ear, who listens, he eyes on Ruth. She WHISPERS something back. It’s decided. With his free hand, Marshall brings out the REVOLVER and it at Ruth’s face. Cringing away from it...  79.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: Don't don't-- He pulls the trigger, she SHRIEKS, it makes a dull click.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALL
dialogues.text: You'll carry this one, okay?

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: W-why?

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALL
dialogues.text: Cause we're shorthanded. Which is on you.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: I don’t want to. For a second, Marshall’s eyes look damn near sympathetic.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALL
dialogues.text: That’s what life is, darlin. Buncha stuff we don’t wanna do.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: You could leave me here. I-I-I‘1l be so quiet. I promise. His eyes turn hard and demonic inside the mask. His gestu accentuate those CAT TATTOOS on his hands.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALL
dialogues.text: Get them to open the door. Point that at whoever it is so nothing happens. We’ll get what we need and we'll leave and that’s it.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: But how do I know you won't, won't... She can’t even finish the thought.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALL
dialogues.text: You know that I will if you don’t.

dialogues.speaker: DEZ
dialogues.text: It’s karma, for Chrissy... Dez holds up a SWITCHBLADE and--snikt!--pops it open.

dialogues.speaker: DEZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That shit’s for real, sister.  80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The most hopeless version of RUTH'S THEME echoes faintly we TRACK HER ACROSS THE LAWN. A long march towards oblivi HER HAND shakes violently. Making a fist doesn’t help. THE REVOLVER is tucked into the small of her back. THE RATTAN YARD ANIMALS, the now-trunkless elephant and t giraffe, seem to watch her as she passes by. She swallows heavily to keep from throwing up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON RUTH, seen from behind, standing at the door. PULLING BACK, there’s Marshall and Dez on either side of pressed against the house, out of sight, GUNS READY. Ruth hesitates. Marshall twitches his gun. So she knocks. CLOSE ON THE PEEPHOLE, which suddenly goes dark. Ruth attempts a smile. Looks like she drank vinegar.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: It’s me again. Sorry. CLOSE ON MARSHALL, off to the side with the .45 up. The c of his mask flutters with his breath. CLOSE ON DEZ, to the other side, with the shotgun. Her ey are cold and steady inside the mask. THE PEEPHOLE goes clear. The DEADBOLT goes click-clack. CESAR opens, eyeing Ruth warily, clocking her EMPTY HANDS

dialogues.speaker: CESAR
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: Please don’t do anything. SHE DRAWS THE GUN ON HIM, on us, that big barrel swinging right up into the lens. And Cesar almost makes a move but, no, his hands go up.  81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruth walks Cesar back as Marshall and Dez slip in behind fanning out, already forgetting the still-open front door Dez covers the INTERIOR HALL as Marshall snags Cesar’s 9m and tosses it aside.

dialogues.speaker: CESAR
dialogues.text: I’m compliant. PAK! Marshall whacks him behind the ear with the barrel o his .45 and Cesar drops to his knees, GROANING. Ruth GASPS at this sudden violence and at that exact mome Meredith comes from the kitchen, sees masked people with and--oops!--turns promptly on her heel to exit again but-

dialogues.speaker: DEZ
dialogues.text: Stop. Fuck. At least she manages to guzzle her drink even as sh lifts her hands, now recognizing Ruth...

dialogues.speaker: MEREDITH
dialogues.text: You.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry. This isn’t my fault.

dialogues.speaker: MEREDITH
dialogues.text: You took my tiger.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: That was me, yes, but not this--

dialogues.speaker: MEREDITH
dialogues.text: You're pointing a gun.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: No, I know, but--

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALL
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up. Sit.

dialogues.speaker: CESAR
dialogues.text: (from the ground) Do what they say, Meredith. As she flops onto the couch in a semi-sober pout...

dialogues.speaker: MEREDITH
dialogues.text: ..-unbelievable...  Pink (mm/dd/yyyy) 82. Marshall nudges Cesar to the couch as well but--

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALL
dialogues.text: You too. Over there. --he doesn’t move fast enough so MARSHALL KICKS HIM. WUNK

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: Don't do that! Meredith reacts to Ruth’s shaken protest--huh?--as Cesar crawls to the couch, hugging his maybe-busted ribs. Dez keeps the shotgun aimed down the HALLWAY into the hou as Marshall squats before Meredith, hissing--

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALL
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: MEREDITH
dialogues.text: Sleeping one off.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALL
dialogues.text: Call him.

dialogues.speaker: MEREDITH
dialogues.text: If you’re here for what you think you're here for, your timing stinks.

dialogues.speaker: CESAR
dialogues.text: Meredith, be quiet.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALL
dialogues.text: Call him. He touches the gun to her chin.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: Just do it. Please. Meredith glares hard at Marshall, at Ruth, and then...

dialogues.speaker: MEREDITH
dialogues.text: (“happy”) Hey, Chris? (beat) CHRIIIIIS.

dialogues.speaker: RUMACK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (from upstairs) What?!  83.

dialogues.speaker: RUMACK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: For whaaat?

dialogues.speaker: COME HERE.
dialogues.text: Angry THUDS and STOMPING from upstairs. Everyone tenses a FOOTSTEPS come fump, fump, fump, fumping! down the stairs Dez slides to the side of the HALLWAY DOOR, so she’s pois right there but out of sight from DOWN THE HALL, where-- Rumack now appears, cinching a robe, irritated and confus

dialogues.speaker: RUMACK
dialogues.text: Is Christian here?

dialogues.speaker: MEREDITH
dialogues.text: No. DOWN THE HALLWAY, Rumack is coming towards us but he slow

dialogues.speaker: RUMACK
dialogues.text: His van’s parked out front. FROM WITHIN THE HALLWAY, RUMACK’S POV: the empty room loo ahead of him, no sign of anything amiss there. But still. His eyes narrow. Wondering at the silence. He backs away. WHILE IN THE FRONT ROOM, Marshall gestures in frustration Say something! At which Meredith shrugs savagely, Like wh

dialogues.speaker: MEREDITH
dialogues.text: Uh. Maybe he’s waiting for you to come outside? You know he doesn’t like me too much. DOWN THE HALLWAY, Rumack reappears but now on full alert, CHROME .38 held before him as he advances.

dialogues.speaker: RUMACK
dialogues.text: Cesar? IN THE FRONT ROOM, Marshall aims at Cesar, finger to his lips, shhh! Ruth just stands off to the side, shaking in place, her g vaguely on Meredith but mostly on the floor.  84. Dez waits beside the HALL DOORWAY, her RUSTY SHOTGUN at h level. All that oxidation crusted around the breach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE HALLWAY, Rumack is almost to the DOOR, his gun hel forward, craning his neck for a wider view of the FRONT R There's Meredith, perched on the couch, oddly stiff.

dialogues.speaker: RUMACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The fuck’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: HIS GUN HAND AS IT PRECEDES HIM INTO THE FRONT R
dialogues.text: extending ahead of his body, visible now to-- DEZ, who's right there, and promptly lowers the SHOTGUN t BAM!--BLAST RUMACK’S HAND INTO RED THREADS. Okay, this all happens in a whirlwind: Rumack SCREAMS and DROPS. Meredith SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH DROPS HER GUN AND IMMEDIATELY PROJECTILE VOMITS. BLA
dialogues.text: CESAR DIVES FOR HER GUN, AIMS ON MARSHALL BUT--click!clic

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: ACROSS THE ROOM, Dez swings the shotgun around to cover Meredith, who alllmost leapt off the couch in her fury bu

dialogues.speaker: KEEP STILL
dialogues.text: Rumack MOANS at Dez’s feet as-- IN THEIR GRAPPLING, Cesar tears Marshall’s mask off just BANG!--Marshall manages to tag him in the head. BRAINS FL And at this, RUTH VOMITS A THIRD GEYSER-LIKE TIME. BWOOOG

dialogues.speaker: OKAY NOW EVERYONE JUST HOLD IT.
dialogues.text: Shaky, vibrating silence in a swirl of cordite. Marshall turns in place, scanning for additional threats. We'll probably notice that he’s wet his pants.  85.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just...hold it for a second. Jesus. Wow. Rumack, hunched over his bloody hand, teeth clenched in p squints up at him...

dialogues.speaker: RUMACK
dialogues.text: I know you. Marshall, right? Your name’s Marshall. You were at one of Christian's hearings last year. Marshall stares at him, his eyes now darting to-- Ruth and Meredith: they heard his name. Saw his face. His eyes dart to Dez, something dark passing between them

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALL
dialogues.text: (refocusing on Rumack) Go on. Get into the fireplace. Silence. Rumack glares at Marshall with white-hot hatred. Ruth gapes in mounting dread: fireplace? What?

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: C'mon. I’1l make it nasty if I have to.

dialogues.speaker: RUMACK
dialogues.text: Is Christian with you?

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALL
dialogues.text: I don’t...look, we’re not talking about this. Just do it, okay?

dialogues.speaker: RUMACK
dialogues.text: What’d he tell you? That I keep cash around? I haven’t seen him in months, you amateurs, it’s not here anymore. Marshall looks like he might have an aneurysm but instead storms over to RIP THE ELECTRIC FIREPLACE LOG OUT thus-- Revealing the SMALL SAFE embedded in the FIREPLACE FLOOR. Marshall points to it like a teacher points to a blackboa Rumack sighs, staggers upright and hobbles across the roo As he begins to work the DIAL under Marshall's watchful e  86.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALL
dialogues.text: Chrissy told us about the iron in there too, so don’t even try that shit.

dialogues.speaker: RUMACK
dialogues.text: Got it all mapped out, dontcha. Over by the couch, Ruth realizes Meredith is staring at h

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: (desperate whisper) I'm a hostage. I was kidnapped. (points to the wound on her forehead) The empty gun? Meredith's expression shifts, hearing the truth in that,

dialogues.speaker: DEZ
dialogues.text: Stop talking. KLIK! THE SAFE unlocks. Marshall waves Rumack aside. Covering Ruth and Meredith, Dez cranes her neck to see-- --as Marshall reaches inside, his fingers scrabbling. But look of dismay quickly overtakes his face. Rumack grins evilly.

dialogues.speaker: RUMACK
dialogues.text: That's right, dumb-dumb. You just bought yourself a murder one ticket for nothing. Woozily, Marshall pulls out a little .25 AUTO, a few PASSPORTS, some STOCK CERTIFICATES...but no cash. Zilch-o He looks at Rumack like he just learned there’s no Santa.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALL
dialogues.text: But...Chrissy said...

dialogues.speaker: RUMACK
dialogues.text: Times are tough all over. (but darkening now) Where is my son? Marshall summons back some force of his own...

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALL
dialogues.text: You don’t have a son, buddy.  Pink (mm/dd/yyyy) 87. That takes the wind out of Rumack’s sails. Dez’s eyes blaze crazily in the mask, impatient and outra Fuck it: she aims on Ruth and Meredith--

dialogues.speaker: DEZ
dialogues.text: We’re done here.

dialogues.speaker: NO.
dialogues.text: Ruth bolts upright, putting herself between Meredith and coming shotgun blast. Rumack tenses and Marshall aims on You can hear a pin drop. Ruth stares at Dez, shivering. RUTH (CONT’D) I won’t let you shoot anyone. Dez gestures wanly at Cesar’s corpse, like ‘Oh no?’ RUTH (CONT’D) Anyone else, I mean. Ruth shakes, fully exposed there before the shotgun. Meredith blinks rapidly, hyperventilating, a PANIC ATTACK Rumack gauges the distance between him and Marshall. Dez squares the shotgun on Ruth’s face but... RUTH (CONT’D) You’1l have to kill me first. Dez glances to Marshall, who shrugs in careless defeat, J do it already. DEZ'S FINGER tightens around the trigger... SHK. Suddenly, oddly, A THROWING STAR IS STUCK IN DEZ’S F TONY is posed post-throw in the vestibule, wide-eyed, jus now dropping the rattan TIGER he’d dragged in with him. W Dez SHRIEKS, tears the cloth of her mask, rips it free: t METAL STAR is sunk deeply into the flesh of her cheek. Rumack lunges at Marshall but--BANG!--Marshall panic fire and POPS RUMACK’S HEAD OPEN. DEZ WHIRLS the shotgun onto Tony, who SQUEALS, but-- BLAM! THE SHOTGUN EXPLODES IN HER HAND. FINGERS FLY.  88. MEREDITH SPRINGS LIKE A GAZELLE OUT OF THE ROOM. Just, po off like a shot, gone before Dez is finished collapsing. Marshall whirls his gun onto Tony but-- RUTH SPRINGS AT HIM, a spastic flying-squirrel leap that KNOCKS HIM DOWN as she claws at his WAVING GUN HAND-- Tony sees this--Ruth in danger!--and he charges but-- Dez, even with her FINGERS BLOWN OFF, her face knotted in rage, uses her good hand to pop her SWITCHBLADE--SNIKT!

dialogues.speaker: SHE LAUNCES INTO TONY AND STABS HIM REPEATEDLY IN THE GUT
dialogues.text: LIGHTNING FAST--tk!tk!tk!tk!tk! She’s a human tattoo gun. As Tony falls, clutching himself, Dez pivots to face the thrashing tangle of Ruth and Marshall, HER KNIFE RAISED, THROWING STAR still glinting in the side of her face-- RUTH BITES MARSHALL’S HAND, MAKES HIM FIRE ONE SHOT--BANG

dialogues.speaker: PTEW
dialogues.text: KAK! WHICH POPS INTO DEZ’S TEMPLE IN A MIST OF PINK. As the abruptly lifeless Dez puddles to the ground... As Tony rolls in a growing pool of his own blood... RUTH CLAMPS ON MARSHALL’S HAND LIKE A PIT BULL. (Did you it takes a crowbar to pry their jaws off? It’s true.) MARSHALL BUCKS AND SQUIRMS AND HOWLS. Sounds like a coyot caught in a bear trap.

dialogues.speaker: CLICK
dialogues.text: Which prompts a surge in her as SHE TWISTS THE .45 FROM MARSHALL’S BLOODY HAND AND--WUP!--CLUBS HIS FACE WITH IT. And for good measure--KAP!--SHE CLUBS HIS KNEE, TOO. Mayb breaking it? Sure did make a gnarly sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, also, MEREDITH SPRINTS down this secluded forest road She must have been a competitive runner at some point: he form is perfect, she is tireless, not stopping for anythi  89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruth scrabbles to Tony, fluttering over his wounds--

dialogues.speaker: RUTH TONY
dialogues.text: Tony! Tony! Oooh she got me good... IN THE BACKGROUND, Marshall staggers bloody-faced to his feet...and he is now between them and the front door. His eyes snap to the .25 AUTO on the ground. He SNATCHES Ruth catches this movement and HEAVES TONY TO HIS FEET-- As Marshall fumbles the gun, racks the slide, aims it-- She shoves Tony out into the--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAM! BAM! SMALL CALIBER GUNSHOTS POP INTO THE WALL direct behind them as they stumble/flee away, Ruth powering Tony forward like a busted shopping cart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruth and Tony burst outside and she scans frantically for escape route, propping him up as he hugs his bloody middl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at all this fucking blood. Dead Cesar. Dead Rumack. Marshall crouches over Dead Dez: silently sobbing and und Wanting to touch her face, her mouth, but afraid to, beca she’s a spirit now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACKING RUTH AND TONY, most of his weight supported on h shoulder as they lurch desperately AROUND THE HUGE HOUSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COMING AROUND THE HOUSE, Ruth heaves and strains under To bloody semi-limp bulk, but freezing suddenly because--  90. MARSHALL, out there in the front yard, crazed and spatter and blocking their way to the road. He spots them, HISSES like a poisonous toad and LIMP-RUNS towards them. RUTH JERKS TONY back around the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACKING RUTH AND TONY DOWN THIS STEEP INCLINE, weaving through the brush and tree cover. Tony can barely stand a Ruth can barely keep him going. But her face is set: hard and determined. Behind them, echoing in the forest, the MOON HOWL of a ra animal. That’d be Marshall, screaming insane nonsense. Ruth urges Tony faster. He trips, FALLS, dragging her dow with him, CRYING OUT in renewed pain. She recovers, helps him up, looks frantically up the hill There’s nobody in sight...but she can hear SOMETHING cras this way through the brush. It HOWLS again.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Gonnna get yoooooouu!

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: Tony. Get up. Let’s go. She powers him up, moves him forward, faster, faster, hur UP AHEAD, what's that?, some kind of MIRRORED LIGHT glint strangely through the veil of old pines. Water?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They burst onto a SMALL SANDY BEACH to see that it’s a curving tree-lined pond with a FORESTED ISLAND maybe a hundred yards out there...or perhaps it’s the far banks? A WOODEN DOCK extends from the beach, with a SMALL OUTBOA FISHING SKIFF moored there, as well as a FLAT-BOTTOM ROWB Ruth scans: to either side of the beach is just a clog of roots, brush, eroded earth. Another HOWL behind them, clo

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: Come on.  Pink (mm/dd/yyyy) 91. She bulls Tony onto the DOCK, lets him sag there as she h into the MOTORBOAT where-- She YANKS the motor pull cord. It SPUTTERS and RUMBLES... doesn’t turn over. She yanks again. And again. Nothing. Her eyes snap to the ROWBOAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony collapses into the bow, whimpering, as Ruth uses an to push them off the dock, braces her feet on the hull... And ROWS LIKE HELL. She has adrenaline super-powers and t little boat slides out into the pond. THE BEACH recedes behind her, she’s staring at it as she steadily. No sign of Marshall. She looks over her shoulde see where they’re heading...the ISLAND on the far side. But also in her view is Tony: pale, drooping, barely awak

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: HEY. Stay awake, okay? He nods weakly, not at all convincing. She looks back and IN THE DISTANCE, there’s the small shape of MARSHALL on t beach now. Standing there, staring at them. She makes a strangled noise and ROWS HARDER. The little MARSHALL-SHAPE appears to take aim. There is a distant popt! and something HUMS over Ruth’s head. She ducks low and ROWS EVEN HARDER as another popt! carri over the water. Another. Something PLUNKS the water nearb THE ISLAND looms near, maybe fifty feet to go? She ROWS. IN THE DISTANCE, she can see the MARSHALL-SHAPE getting i the MOTORBOAT. The MOTOR growls to life out there. And now it's coming this way. Quickly closing the gap bet them. She heaves against the oars. The oar-locks SNAP and RATTL with the force of her effort. Her BREATH pulses raggedly. And here comes the motorboat, ever closer with Marshall visible there, his hand on the tiller. He's pointing at h  Pink (mm/dd/yyyy) 92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE ROWBOAT’S BOW crunches against soft land. Ruth startl didn’t realize she was so close, she scrambles into the b SHE DRAGS TONY OUT and grabs the balled-up GREEN WEATHER as she goes, glancing out at-- THE MOTORBOAT, zooming in, forty feet away, thirty five. can see the details of Marshall’s blood-caked face. DEEPER IN THE BRUSH, she leads Tony to a MOSSY OVERHANG, presses him down onto the ground, pulls the WEATHER COVER over him like a kid home sick from school--

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: (frantic whisper) Stay here. Don't move. Don't make a sound. He's coming.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: «..W-why?

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: We know who he is. SHE TEARS HER SLEEVE OFF, presses it to his wounds, press his hands down on top of it... RUTH (CONT’D) Keep pressure there, okay? I'll be back. She starts to cover him but he grabs at her hand--

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I'm scared.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: Me too. Don't move. She kisses his forehead, pulls the cover over him and wip an armful of DEAD LEAVES over it. Not exactly invisible b it’1l have to do... RUTH EMERGES FROM THE TREE LINE and waves her arms just a RUTH (CONT’D) Hey, fuckface! THE MOTORBOAT RUNS AGROUND and Marshall comes hobbling ov the bow, waving that .25 wildly in her direction. SHE RUNS back into the TREES, away from Tony, as--  93. BAM! BAM! BAM! BULLETS WHIZ OVER AND AROUND HER. SHE SPRINTS THROUGH THE DARK TANGLE OF VEGETATION. Her feet SUCK into saturated ground. BRANCHES slash at he face. BEHIND HER, Marshall takes steady aim at her quickly vanishing form and--BAM!BAM!BAM! Click. Blowing in frustration, he tosses the empty weapon aside dashes after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RUTH LEAPS DOWN A LOW HILL, stumbles, unable to control h momentum and-- SPLASH! DROPS INTO BLACK CHEST-DEEP WATER. The layer of leaves on the surface made it practically invisible. Gasping and sputtering, she reaches about for something t hold onto...there! A ROOT dangling into the pool... Taking hold, she pulls herself forward...but she freezes. If her expression was one of frightened determination bef it is now replaced by a sort of existential cosmic terror

dialogues.speaker: THE BROWN BEADY-EYED SNOUT OF A COTTONMOUTH SNAK
dialogues.text: calmly winding its way across the surface of the dark wat CLOSE ON RUTH, locking eyes with this evil, alien thing. A BIRD’S EYE VIEW ON THE POOL: where Ruth holds perfectly still and the undulating S-shape of the snake's body glid within striking distance of her face. It takes forever bu ...it passes her by. Not exactly breathing again, she inc her way up out of the pool, pulling herself on the root. On solid ground again, shuddering, she looks back to see. MARSHALL, emerging from the forest, this limping curl-han troll. He sees her. His eyes blaze with hate and killin’. HE LIMP-TROTS towards her. SHE SCRAMBLES UP A MUDDY RIDGE, taking the high ground. TRACKING WITH RUTH as she moves along the ridge but, DOWN BELOW, Marshall keeps pace with her.  94.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALL
dialogues.text: I see you, girl. RUTH DOUBLES BACK but Marshall keeps pace again.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gonna get ya. SHE HIDES BEHIND A TREE, stooping to grab a BASEBALL-SIZE ROCK out of the muck at her feet. Catching her breath. IN THE BACKGROUND, BELOW THE RIDGE, we can see Marshall catching his breath, too. Watching her hiding place. Without being able to see one another, they call out...

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: Why don’t you just leave me alone? From below, he chuckles wetly and brings out a BUTTERFLY KNIFE, quietly unfolds it.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALL
dialogues.text: Sure. Come on down here, we'll shake on it.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: You do those tattoos yourself? He glances in brief uncertainty at his hands.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALL
dialogues.text: Some.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: Yeah? Well, they looking fucking stupid. MARSHALL EDGES CLOSER, nearing the base of the ridge, tracking her voice...

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALL
dialogues.text: You ever eat cat meat?

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: You mean...cat food?

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALL
dialogues.text: No. The meat of a cat. HE BEGINS TO CRAWL UP THE RIDGE, slithering closer to her behind the tree there, that gleaming blade in his fist...  95. FROM BEHIND THE TREE, Ruth looks for an escape. Further u all BRUSH AND VINES, too thick to even see through. Trapp So she collects a SECOND ROCK and edges around the tree t try and see him...

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: No, man. I never ate any cat meat.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALL
dialogues.text: It makes you be invisible. Did you know that?

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: Have you eaten cat meat?

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALL
dialogues.text: That’s what my marks are for. CLOSE ON RUTH, just a sliver of her eyeball visible aroun the curve of the tree as she sees... A SLIVER OF MARSHALL'S HEAD, just starting to appear up t ridge, very close now...

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, that shit doesn’t work because I can see you. Marshall looks up. Their eyes meet. He grins nastily.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALL
dialogues.text: Doesn't last forever, a’course. There’s a charged moment, two animals clocking each other the bad bush, and then...

dialogues.speaker: WHERE HE INSTANTLY THRASHES AND SHRIEKS-
dialogues.text: RUTH HOPS DOWN THE RIDGE AND CIRCLES WIDE BECAUSE--—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His SCREAM is as high and piercing as a tea kettle on boi His MAD EYES know he’s done with that fat brown rope curl on itself, latched onto his face as he lurches in the muc RUTH SPRINTS THROUGH THE FOREST. Jagged, disconnected glimpses of movement, her POUNDING BREATH subsumes all so in the mix, even Marshall’s sickly keening. She runs faster and faster through the dim slash of vines low branches, ONE SHOT INDISTINGUISHABLE FROM THE NEXT. She pauses, looking left and right: which way? She runs b quickly doubles back. She runs. She doubles back again. SHE TURNS IN PLACE, surrounded on all sides by trees and gloom, trees and gloom, trees and gloom. It all looks the same. She is lost. For the first time on this island, the fire in her seems go out. She sags against a tree, sinking into despair. But then she sees something. It stops her breathing. THERE IN THE DISTANCE, standing calmly beside a great mos tree in her neat pantsuit with a Virginia Slim 100 carefu balanced in her thin fingers, is GRANDMA SALLY. Ruth stares at her in dreamy exhaustion. Sally takes a demure drag and, with a knowing smile, tips head in a certain direction. That way. Ruth’s eyes fill with tears as all sound is replaced by a OLD COUNTRY GOSPEL STANDARD, “This World Is Not My Home” Fern Jones. ‘I can't feel at home in this world anymore,’ Fern warble over a plucky banjo, this SONG carrying over as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruth returns to Tony’s hiding place, yanks the cover back But he’s dead. Ghostly white, eyes closed in peace. We can’t hear her wail of grief but she doesn’t pause for second, wrapping her arms around his middle, hoisting him  97.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall crawls along the forest floor, slug-like, lost. face is HUGELY SWOLLEN around black FANG MARKS, a vivid scarlet hue. His TONGUE lolls wetly in his yellow mouth. He howls but of course we can’t hear him. In the sky above, CROWS are already circling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SONG CONTINUES as Ruth angles the boat full-throttle across the water, tears spilling down her cheeks but whol focused on the task of getting them back to shore. Curled in the bow like a rag doll, Tony could almost be asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SONG CONTINUES over this CLOSE-UP ON THREE DMV PRINTO driver's license shots of Marshall, Dez, and Ruth. A HAND slides the shots of Marshall and Dez to one side.. then taps the shot of Ruth. It's MEREDITH, her eyes puffy from crying but in control. taps Ruth’s photo again and simply shakes her head. Not h INT. BENDIX’S CUBICLE - POLICE STATION - NIGHT THE SONG CONTINUES as we find Ruth sitting here, a BANDAG over her brow, numbed by grief. She’s very still, just watching as... Detective Bendix intently reads over a series of REPORT SHEETS. He finally sets them aside, nodding to himself. Ruth stares at him. He stares back. Exhales hugely, about make a huge pronouncement.

dialogues.speaker: BENDIX
dialogues.text: My wife and I are going to give it another shot. He nods sagely, as if this must answer any and all questi Ruth stares at him.  Pink (mm/dd/yyyy) 98.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SONG CONTINUES and some time has passed now, because just has a regular small BAND AID over her brow. She listlessly strips an empty bed, wadding up sheets tha have a small smear of blood on them. Robotic in her work. INT. RUTH’S CAR (MOVING) - DAY THE SONG CONTINUES as we find Ruth though the windshield, staring numbly out at... THAT ROLLIN’ COAL PICKUP, ahead of her in traffic again, blowing its black sooty smoke into the air. She has no reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SONG CONTINUES as we PUSH DOWN THE AISLE, past rows o CHURCHGOERS, to find Ruth sitting all alone in the back p She's staring off, maybe listening to the sermon, maybe n

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SONG FADES AWAY now and we find Ruth sitting in one o her outdoor chairs, gazing out contemplatively. An upbeat OLDIE ("Don’t Hang Up” by The Orlons) plays on portable speaker somewhere, but sounds distant and faint. She sips a SODA POP, Tony’s brand. We realize that she is looking at... JANA, by the fence, watching a blinking chorus of FIREFLI Not trying to capture them, just watching, delighted. Angie is in the chair next to Ruth, a fresh drink in her hand. They sit in silence a moment. Angie eyes her.

dialogues.speaker: ANGIE
dialogues.text: You okay? Ruth nods absently.

dialogues.speaker: ANGIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Be gentle with yourself, okay? You got all the time in the world. Ruth takes a deep breath, nods again, but...  Pink (mm/dd/yyyy) 99.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: I don’t know what that means. Angie looks out at Jana, shrugs...

dialogues.speaker: ANGIE
dialogues.text: It’s just something people say. Ruth sniffs, a tired little laugh. And then she turns her head. Sees something. Stares at it a bit. TONY smiles at her from within a white Heavenly mist. A d or a ghost or a vision. Ruth smiles back. WIDER, oh, okay, it actually is Tony, for real: he uses a cane now, and he’s working the smoking grill, just burnin the shit out of some hamburgers. Dan looks on in obvious disapproval, shaking his head. Tony points the spatula at Ruth, gives an assured thumbs She smiles and looks back to... THE FIREFLIES. Look at ‘em glow and vanish in the fade. CUT TO BLACK. As “I Love You, Honeybear” by Father John Misty takes us the credits...
